# Implementation Report: Native Theme System for Bridge App
Generated: 2026-01-17T13:58:00Z

## Task
Implement native iOS theme system using PlatformColor to replace custom colors for a native feel with automatic dark mode support.

### Implementation

#### Created: `/home/gabrielolv/Documents/Projects/ter/lib/colors.ts`
New native color system providing:
- `systemColors` - Object with iOS PlatformColor values and Android hex fallbacks
- `hostColors` - Array of 6 system colors for host differentiation
- `statusColors` - Semantic status mapping (running, stopped, idle, etc.)

#### Modified: `/home/gabrielolv/Documents/Projects/ter/lib/theme.ts`
- Added import of `systemColors` and `hostColors` from `./colors`
- Added `@deprecated` JSDoc to `palette` object
- Added `@deprecated` JSDoc to `hostAccents` array
- Added re-export: `export { systemColors, hostColors } from './colors'`
- Added documentation comment to `navTheme` explaining string color requirement

## Notes
- Backwards compatible: All existing `palette.*` and `hostAccents` usages continue to work
- React Navigation requires string colors, so `navTheme` still uses `palette` values
- iOS dark mode will work automatically for components using `systemColors`
- Android fallbacks are light-mode only (can extend with Appearance API if needed)
- No component changes made - this establishes the new color system for gradual migration
